modules.description: Provides functions to format and output structured data with styling options, supporting escape sequences and custom styles. Works with Format.formatter, Buffer.t, and out_channel types to render content in various output destinations. Enables terminal output with color and formatting by converting data structures into styled strings or directly to channels.

Provides functions to serialize data into a buffer, string, or output channel, and to send data directly to standard output, standard error, or a formatter. Works with the `t` type, which represents compacted data structures. Used to efficiently output structured data in specific formats without additional overhead.

Provides functions for formatting and parsing structured text, including indentation management, line breaking, and nested block handling. Works with strings, lists, and custom format trees representing document layouts. Used to generate readable JSON-like output and to process configuration files with complex nesting.

formats structured data with styling, support for terminal output, and efficient serialization to buffers, strings, or channels; operates on `t` type and uses Format.formatter, Buffer.t, and out_channel for flexible output; allows generating colored, formatted strings or direct output to terminals and files; enables concise rendering of data with custom styles or plain text.
